docs.abstract: Public health experts are concerned that mass demonstrations could seed a possible second wave of infections.
docs.snippet: Public health experts are concerned that mass demonstrations could seed a possible second wave of infections.
docs.lead_paragraph: The mass protests against police brutality and racism roiling dozens of cities across the United States have prompted officials and public health experts to warn of a possible second wave of coronavirus outbreaks.

docs.abstract: House Republicans are on the defensive in suburban strongholds as voters reject President Trump’s handling of the coronavirus.
docs.snippet: House Republicans are on the defensive in suburban strongholds as voters reject President Trump’s handling of the coronavirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: BALLWIN, Mo. — For Heather Vaughn, a substitute teacher and graduate student, the decision last month to place the black sign with colorful lettering in her front yard — the one that said, “Black Lives Matter” and “Science is Real” — felt like an act of courage.

headline.main: Alienated by Trump, Suburban Voters Sour on G.O.P. in Battle for the House
headline.print_headline: Suburban Dismay Imperils G.O.P. in House

byline.original: By Emily Cochrane and Catie Edmondson

docs.abstract: “It’s going away” only in the president’s delusion.
docs.snippet: “It’s going away” only in the president’s delusion.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump says the coronavirus is “fading away” and pats himself on the back for “a great job on CoronaVirus” that saved “millions of U.S. lives.”

headline.main: Trump Is Feeding America’s Coronavirus Nightmare
headline.print_headline: Trump Is Feeding America’s Coronavirus Nightmare

docs.abstract: The government could revive an idea to make it mandatory for large companies to report their pay gaps by ethnicity.
docs.snippet: The government could revive an idea to make it mandatory for large companies to report their pay gaps by ethnicity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly two years ago, the British government seemed to be on the verge of doing something truly novel about racial and ethnic inequality. Theresa May, the prime minister at the time, had adopted a plan to root out one of the causes of differences in incomes that would “create a fairer and more diverse work force,” she said.

headline.main: In Britain, an Idea to Reduce Racial Inequality Gains Momentum
headline.print_headline: A U.K. Move To Air Out Salary Gaps

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Equality and Human Rights Commission (Great Britain)

docs.abstract: Greg Selkoe is leaving the successful esports conglomerate to start a new venture that’s less “frat house” and more diverse.
docs.snippet: Greg Selkoe is leaving the successful esports conglomerate to start a new venture that’s less “frat house” and more diverse.
docs.lead_paragraph: FaZe Clan, an esports lifestyle conglomerate, helped turn gamers into a new class of social media influencers. Now, several top executives behind FaZe Clan are leaving to start a competing organization called XSET.

headline.main: FaZe Clan President Departs: ‘It’s Time for Gaming to Clean Up Its Act’
headline.print_headline: ‘It’s Time for Gaming to Clean Up Its Act’

byline.original: By Taylor Lorenz and Kellen Browning

docs.abstract: For two decades, domestic counterterrorism strategy has ignored the rising danger of far-right extremism. In the atmosphere of willful indifference, a virulent movement has grown and metastasized.
docs.snippet: For two decades, domestic counterterrorism strategy has ignored the rising danger of far-right extremism. In the atmosphere of willful indifference, a virulent movement has grown and metastasized.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first indication to Lt. Dan Stout that law enforcement’s handling of white supremacy was broken came in September 2017, as he was sitting in an emergency-operations center in Gainesville, Fla., preparing for the onslaught of Hurricane Irma and watching what felt like his thousandth YouTube video of the recent violence in Charlottesville, Va. Jesus Christ, he thought, studying the footage in which crowds of angry men, who had gathered to attend or protest the Unite the Right rally, set upon one another with sticks and flagpole spears and flame throwers and God knows what else. A black man held an aerosol can, igniting the spray, and in retaliation, a white man picked up his gun, pointed it toward the black man and fired it at the ground. The Virginia state troopers, inexplicably, stood by and watched. Stout fixated on this image, wondering what kind of organizational failure had led to the debacle. He had one month to ensure that the same thing didn’t happen in Gainesville.

headline.main: U.S. Law Enforcement Failed to See the Threat of White Nationalism. Now They Don’t Know How to Stop It.

docs.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Friday, September 4, 2020.
docs.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Friday, September 4, 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: “I was out there every night. It felt like the sit-in movement to me. It felt like everything I’ve been living all my life. You see yourself again at 17, 18 and 19.”

headline.main: Quotation of the Day: After a Steadfast March, an Activist Steps Aside

docs.abstract: Our focus on the problems with inner-city education has left us with big blind spots.
docs.snippet: Our focus on the problems with inner-city education has left us with big blind spots.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Sweet Home Central School District serves about 3,000 K-12 students in the towns of Amherst and Tonawanda, N.Y., two suburbs on the north side of Buffalo. A little over two decades ago, Sweet Home was 88 percent white, 7 percent Black and 1.6 percent Hispanic. By the 2019-20 school year, white students made up only 62 percent of the students districtwide, while the Black and Hispanic populations increased to 20 percent and 5 percent, respectively.

docs.abstract: If convicted, the two residents of Martinez, Calif., could face up to a year in jail, prosecutors say.
docs.snippet: If convicted, the two residents of Martinez, Calif., could face up to a year in jail, prosecutors say.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two white people in California were charged on Tuesday with a hate crime and other offenses after video appeared to show them vandalizing a Black Lives Matter mural on July 4, officials said.

headline.main: 2 People Charged With Hate Crime After Black Lives Matter Mural Is Vandalized

docs.abstract: Donors have given more than $90 million to help buy the freedom of those awaiting trial behind bars.
docs.snippet: Donors have given more than $90 million to help buy the freedom of those awaiting trial behind bars.
docs.lead_paragraph: One afternoon in June, Elisabeth Epps hopped into her partner’s Jeep and rode from Denver to Boulder, carrying cashier’s checks worth nearly $16,000.

headline.main: Bail Funds, Flush With Cash, Learn to ‘Grind Through This Horrible Process’
headline.print_headline: Bail Funds Raise Millions, And Visibility, Amid Protests
